definition: to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
to grow/to plant/to insert/to force on sb/to fall head first
scallion/green onion

sentences.english: George jumped from the basket and fell headlong into the snow.
sentences.chinese: 乔治从车斗里跳出来，倒栽葱地摔倒在雪地里。

sentences.english: The rabbit scratched a hole in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 天太黑，杰克倒栽葱地摔进一个大坑里。

sentences.english: He was so fast that he knocked an old man head over heels.
sentences.chinese: 他走得那样快，把一个老人撞了个倒栽葱。

sentences.english: The rope was also broken and the donkey fell head over heels into the river.
sentences.chinese: 绳子也弄断了，驴子倒栽葱似的掉进河里。

sentences.english: He fell neck and crop off the horse.
sentences.chinese: 他从马上倒栽葱地摔了下来。

sentences.english: She fell headlong into the icy pool.
sentences.chinese: 她倒栽葱掉进了冰冷的水池中。

definition: to fall flat on one's face (vulgar)
to fall flat on one's face
face-plant
four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back
head down/upside down
to take a fall
to stagger/to stumble/to reel/Taiwan pr. [lie4 ju1]
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
tumble/somersault
to fling/to fall/to wear
sprawled out on one's back (idiom)
to fall flat on one's face/(martial arts) pouncing and falling (i.e. all kinds of moves)
(onom.) sound of object falling into water/plop
tumble/somersault
to fall to one's death
stumble
